participant_1.background:
It's a bit chilly, but I'm looking forward to taking my dog hiking later.
i work at a newspaper.
i have six tattoos , all of cats.
my father is a retired police officer.
I teach my students about art and share my opinions about art on the internet.

participant_2.background:
I have a book of nursery rhymes for my infant son.
i have 5 brothers and sisters.
I am still single, because I have been on my own for too long, to give my heart away to just anyone.
i teach kindergarten.
i have a job as an it agent.

content.text: Hi! My name is participant_1. How are you today?
Hello participant_2, I'm doing well today. Thank you for asking. And you?
Doing well! I'm looking forward to taking my dog hiking later. What are you up to today?
I'm working on lesson plans for my kindergarten class. I have a new student who just moved in and I'm trying to figure out how to best help him get acclimated.
That sounds like a lot of fun! I love working with kids. I used to teach art to middle school students.
I'm sure you were great at it! I've always been a bit of an introvert, so working with kids can be challenging for me. But it's also very rewarding.
I can understand that. I'm an introvert too, but I find that working with kids helps me come out of my shell.
That's great! I'm glad to hear that.
So, what's your favorite nursery rhyme?
That's a tough question! I think I'd have to say "The Itsy Bitsy Spider." It's just so catchy and fun.
I agree! That's one of my favorites too.
I'm glad to hear that. We should sing it together sometime!
That sounds like a great idea! I'd love that.
Great! I'll bring the book of nursery rhymes and we can sing all our favorites.
Sounds like a plan! I'm looking forward to it.
